pullRequest.body:
This PR proves the monotonicity of `n ‚Ü¶ s ^ n` under various conditions. Also rename `empty_nsmul` to `nsmul_empty`.

From GrowthInGroups


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [b6f95aca24](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18003/commits/b6f95aca24d0fc1ed59b22215f0a2c024d8df840)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Nonempty.card_pow_mono`
`+ card_le_card_pow`
`+ card_pow_le`
`+ card_pow_mono`
`++ empty_nsmul`
`++ empty_zpow`
`++ singleton_pow`
`++ singleton_zpow`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
@loefflerd, please don't use `WIP` on other people's PRs. Here, `awaiting-CI` is more appropriate.
"Awaiting CI" does not fit for a PR where the latest CI run had completed with a failure, as was the case when I tagged it (while browsing #queue for low-hanging fruit).

> "Awaiting CI" does not fit for a PR where the latest CI run had completed with a failure

Where did you get that from? `awaiting-CI` means "Once this PR passes CI, it is ready for you". In contrast, `WIP` means "Once this PR passes CI, please don't review just yet because I might have to do other changes". This is why only the former is automatically removed when CI passes.
Thank you for the clarification on the meanings of the various tags. I'm puzzled why this PR showed up in #queue at all, but that is not important now.
Yes that's confusing! üòÅ cc @grunweg if you want to investigate

If I can say something useful depends on that "#queue" refers to. The zulip linkifier #queue is just a shorthand to some github search (currently [this one]), which I did not work on. I did work on the "[queueboard](https://jcommelin.github.io/queueboard/index.html)" a lot recently. Sadly, at the moment its data is not always fully in sync with github's.
I have several ideas why and plans how to fix this, but making this robust will require some work :grimacing: That said: the [queue dashboard](https://jcommelin.github.io/queueboard/index.html#queue) uses the same data as github, so should be reliable.

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11464718079/job/31901544440)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11464718079/job/31901544197)
bors d+
Let's add a crossref from this to the nonempty one, and vice versa
gcongr on (a version of) this and below?

I already tried and `gcongr` doesn't like it, probably because it's the composition of two functions:
```
@[gcongr] attribute only applies to lemmas proving f x‚ÇÅ ... x‚Çô ‚àº f x‚ÇÅ' ... x‚Çô'.
 Not all arguments are free variables in the conclusion of ‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_2} [inst : DecidableEq Œ±]
  [inst_1 : CancelMonoid Œ±] {s : Finset Œ±} {m n : ‚Ñï}, m ‚â† 0 ‚Üí m ‚â§ n ‚Üí #(s ^ m) ‚â§ #(s ^ n)
  ```
Ah, okay... I wonder if this could be added to gcongr? @hrmacbeth, what do you think?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Pointwise): growth of finsets
